channel.title: Open-iot-challenge-entries on Eclipse IoT
channel.description: Recent content in Open-iot-challenge-entries on Eclipse IoT

item.title: Activ-IoTy Timekeeping - Final Report
item.description: Watch the video summarizing all the work done in this project in just 3 minutes.

item.title: Alya-Smart-Mirror OpenIoTChallenge Final Report
item.description: There are already many impressive open source smart-mirror projects out there but we wanted to achieve even more.

item.title: Aquaponics - Final Report
item.description: In this system that we are going to set up, a water pump, powered by solar panels, will be used to transport the water with fish waste to the plants.

item.title: Autonomy of Things - Final Report
item.description: Three months ago i took the chance to make a commitmentâ€Šâ€”â€Što realise an idea i had for years. Long before it became known as the Internet-Of-Things, i connected devices with wires and radio frequency.

item.title: CISSOS - Final Report
item.description: We wanted to investigate how open-source software from the Eclipse IoT community can be used to build a full (I)IoT solution-stack from sensor to visualization based on the classical three tier architecture for IoT.

item.title: Cloud Oscilloscope - Final Report
item.description: Welcome to our journey to Open IoT Challenge by Eclipse! Last December our proposal was chosen from 70 proposal to participate. Also we’ve got a promocode for electronics and started to work.

item.title: IIOT2K IoT Framework - Final Report
item.description: I start to design and write the IIOT2K framework and share it with to you in conjunction with Eclipse IoT challenge 4.0. I hope that my framework helps IoT enthusiasts to realize there IoT projects in easily way. I would happy for suggestions for this project.

item.title: MoDeS3 - The Smart City - Final Report
item.description: We continued the MoDeS3 project (which won third place in 2016) and we built a smart city on top of the physical architecture.

item.title: OpenNMS - Final Report
item.description: The aim of this project is to use IoT pollution measurements as a compelling use case to prove a design for an MQTT plugin for OpenNMS.

item.title: Poulpy - Final Report
item.description: Poulpy was born with the intent of creating a connected aquarium network all over the country so people can monitor their aquariums and learn more about marine life.

item.title: Smart solar water heating (SWH) - Final Report
item.description: Smart solar water heating solution uses IoT and AI technologies to improve the efficiency of passive solar water heating system. This solution has been developed to take part in the Open IoT Challenge 4.0!

item.title: SmartOASYS - Final Report
item.description: SmartOASYS is a dashboard for Water Monitoring system using IoT - PaaS

item.title: Trusting IoT - Final Report
item.description: n this post, we make a similar journey through our participation in the Eclipse Open IoT Challenge 4.0 with the project trusted indoor positioning system for nursing homes.

item.title: Trync - Final Report
item.description: Here I’m going to write the worst final report for Open IoT Challenge 4.0 (may be the worst one in the Open IoT challenge history too ðŸ˜ž). Because than writing how we got success I’m writing here how we got failed.

item.title: What about you (WAY) - Final Report
item.description: What About You (WAY) is a project which has an IoT theme, a social & enjoyable characteristic and open source technologies. It focuses on informing people about each otherâ€™s mood.
